radiographic_examinations.findings: The appendix is dilated measuring up to 11 mm. The wall is hyperemic. There is surrounding stranding in the mesenteric fat. There is a trace amount of free fluid in the right lower pelvis. The imaged portion of the large bowel is normal with a moderate fecal load. The imaged small bowel loops are prominent, although not dilated. The wall is minimally thickened, likely due to secondary inflammatory changes. The bladder and prostate are unremarkable. There is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy. There are no concerning lytic or sclerotic osseous lesions. No fracture or degenerative changes are identified.
